name: Residence Inn San Diego Downtown/Gaslamp Quarter

reviews.text: This hotel is in a prime location within the Gaslamp Quarter. A block from the Padres stadium and walking distance to the convention center. All the restaurants and bars you could want (casual, nice, etc.) within walking distance too. The hotel itself was nice, clean, and did the job! The staff were courteous and helped me with advice on where to run (beautiful waterfront!). The gym was a bit weak. The free breakfast at Residence Inns is a big plus and the rooms were very comfortable. They only had valet parking as an option and it was a bit pricey.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Good location and very clean room. We did not have reservations and they were very accomodating. Asked for a room away from the elevator and staff was very helpful to help out. Lots of good places to eat within walking distance. Breakfast included. Parking is very expensive, not included in the cost for the night stay. There are parking garages close. We parked in a garage right next to the hotel and it cost us $26 for less than 24 hours! My only personal complaint is the bed was too hard. Didn't sleep very well. Not sure if I would stay there again unless I asked for a soft bed (if possible). Free wi-fi. All and all very nice hotel.
reviews.title: Weekend getaway

reviews.text: Residence Inn is becoming my fast favorite. Nice room. Great customer service. Very good breakfast. Close to convention center, about 5 minute walk. Very accommodating for my early morning east coast teleconference. Didn't use kitchen, but looked functional. Reliable wi-fi. Can't ask for much more. Very quiet room.
reviews.title: Great Room. Superior Service.

reviews.text: Great location of this Residence Inn, blocks to Petco, just off the main drag of the Gaslamp and near the convention center. Rooms were laid out a bit odd, as I couldn't see the tv clearly from the bed due to the placement of the vanity, but the service was good and the room was spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location

reviews.text: Tip: You can save money on parking by going to the deck less than 2 blocks away on 6th for $10/night.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel, pefect location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This has to be one of the nicest Residence Inn properties that I have ever stayed in. Ideally located in the heart of the Gaslamp Quarter, this hotel is modern and comfortable. Like all Residence Inns we had a small kitchen, but who needs that with all the wonderful restaurants within walking distance. Breakfast was included in our rate and it was a really nice spread of food with the usual buffet standards of cereal, bagels and fruit, but also included make your own waffles, and hot breakfast items. For those wanting to maintain their fitness routines there is a small fitness center upstairs adjacent to the pool. Although I did not use the pool, it is small and doesn't appear to get a great deal of sun. But San Diego has great beaches instead.
reviews.title: One of the best Residence Inns I have stayed at

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My only minor complaints were that there was no in-room safe and the parking through the hotel is expensive - $38 night. There are plenty of self- park lots nearby, but they don't have the in and out privileges that the hotel valet had.
reviews.title: met all expectations

reviews.text: If I found my self in downtown San Diego in the future, I would definitely consider staying here again.
reviews.title: Great location...thats about where it ends
Super stay
reviews.text: helpful and pleasant front desk staff, nice room and bathroom, kitchette was a plus with refridge, quiet, good location near restaurants, nightlife, convention center, etc....easy to walk to many attractions from here

I just spent the last week here on vacation with my husband and one year old daughter. The location was nice to be able to walk around and get a bite to eat but terrible when it came to wanting some peace and quiet at night. All weekend long there were people hollering and sirens outside our window well into the early morning.
reviews.title: Great location, service and breakfast were terrific too

reviews.text: My husband loved the big refrigerator. This hotel offered good value, it was fairly spacious, clean, friendly staff and good location. The breakfast was good. The layout was awkward as the bathroom sink light , which was outside the bathroom, shone brightly on the bed and the TV was on the wall, parallel to the couch! making it hard to see the TV from the couch. There was a World Market nearby where you could stock up on beer, wine and snacks.
reviews.title: Good for long term visit

reviews.text: The service was great. I especially appreciated the kindness and hospitality of Cathy the front desk receptionist. She was fantastic! When we arrived there was a complication with the billing of the rooms. Cathy was very thorough and accomodating. She made sure we understood what was happening and why. She made sure our questions and concerns were addressed. Our stay was lovely. Cathy even went the extra mile to write a hand written note wishing me a pleasant stay. She is the type of employee that makes the Marriott, Marriott quality.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the doormen to the front desk to housekeeping, the staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. Our room was well-appointed and felt like an upscale hotel. This Residence Inn is perfectly located within easy walking distance to many excellent restaurants and the water. Loved the breakfasts on the second floor. Truly surprised at how good everything was.
reviews.title: A Warm Welcome and Stay

reviews.text: The Gaslamp Residence Inn is a great hotel, particularly for families. We've stayed at many Residence Inns and this is the top one. Friendly and helpful staff, especially at breakfast. (Make-your-own waffles are a must.) For other meals, loads of choices nearby. Nice outdoor pool, too. Parking ... yikes. About $40 per night, which seems excessive since the hotel rates are not inexpensive. Other parking options nearby. Overall, I wouldn't hesitate up stay here again.
reviews.title: Outstanding hotel, great location, would stay here again

reviews.text: The rooms were very nice - very comfortable for a "residence" hotel, which can sometimes feel worn down. This one was newer and nice and had the feel of a more upscale hotel. It was very convenient to the Gaslamp, the stadium and the harbor. I would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Stayed at RI/Gaslamp Quater for a conference at the convention center last week. This hotel was not on the original hotel conference list but I'm glad we thought outside of the box. Didn't know what to expect but pleasantly surprised from the curb to the front desk to our room.
reviews.title: Great accommodations - Great customer service!

reviews.text: Usually with a conference or large business hotel, check-in is less than pleasant due to the volume of people coming and going. We were greeted by a genuinely friendly and pleasant front desk staff member. When asked if it was possible to check in early, we were told our assigned room was not ready but there was another room available. Our bags were brought up by a friendly bellman who kept our car at the curb until we decided where we were going to park - hotel valet or a local lot. We eventually chose the hotel valet.
reviews.title: Good location, good price

reviews.text: The room was great - clean, large, fully equipped kitchenette, great bed, great housekeeping service. The only downside was the street noise on Friday night that lasted until about 2am. Not sure where it was coming from but there was a Padre's game that night and the town was hopping. Would not have minded it but we had an early wake up the next morning.
reviews.title: Perfect Place to stay

reviews.text: -Price included complimentary breakfast of eggs and meat as well as belgian waffles, cereal, fruit, yogurt, etc. and a happy hour with complimentary appetizers.
reviews.title: Friendly, comfortable, convenient!

reviews.text: -Much closer to the convention center than it looks on a map - easy couple of blocks - 5 min. walk.
reviews.title: Not your typical Residence Inn

aka: Residence Inn San Diego Downtown/Gaslamp Quarter Hotel
description: Embodies the urban and eclectic styles of the modern-day Gaslamp Quarter. Guests enjoy the residential feel and strong sense of space in a comfortable and progressive setting. Start your day with complimentary hot breakfast, stay connected with complimentary high-speed-internet-access and step out into the vibrancy of downtown. Conveniently located just 2 blocks from the Convention Center and PETCO Park. Relax by the lobby fireplace and rooftop pool, rejuvenate in the fitness center and full-service lounge.
